thread.title: Photos: Space Coast VW Fest in Satellite Beach
thread.title_full: Photos: Space Coast VW Fest in Satellite Beach

title: Photos: Space Coast VW Fest in Satellite Beach
text: Photos: Space Coast VW Fest in Satellite Beach Buy Photo At right is a 1964 Karmann Ghia. Hundreds of bug-loving fans showed up Sunday at the David R. Schechter Center in Satellite Beach to enjoy the Volkswagens of the past and present at the second annual Space Coast VW Fest. Karmann Ghias, vans and dune buggies were all part of the show that included the band Gemini and vendors selling everything from ice cream cookies to car speakers in VW van shapes. All proceeds went to Brevard Zoo's Oyster Restoration Project. Hillard Grossman/FLORIDA TODAY Fullscreen Buy Photo Hundreds of bug-loving fans showed up Sunday at the David R. Schechter Center in Satellite Beach to enjoy the Volkswagens of the past and present at the second annual Space Coast VW Fest. Karmann Ghias, vans and dune buggies were all part of the show that included the band Gemini and vendors selling everything from ice cream cookies to car speakers in VW van shapes. All proceeds went to Brevard Zoo's Oyster Restoration Project. Hillard Grossman/FLORIDA TODAY Fullscreen Buy Photo The VW logo on a van is unmistakable. Hundreds of bug-loving fans showed up Sunday at the David R. Schechter Center in Satellite Beach to enjoy the Volkswagens of the past and present at the second annual Space Coast VW Fest. Karmann Ghias, vans and dune buggies were all part of the show that included the band Gemini, above, and vendors selling everything from ice cream cookies to car speakers, left, in VW van shapes. All proceeds went to Brevard Zoo's Oyster Restoration Project. Hillard Grossman/FLORIDA TODAY Fullscreen Buy Photo The band Gemini performed an array of classic hits.
